urls.description: Read the full strategy here “We envision an Indo-Pacific that is open, connected, prosperous, resilient, and secure—and we are ready to work together with

tweets.text: What happens in the Indo-Pacific will shape the world’s trajectory in the 21st century. Our Indo-Pacific Strategy lays out a shared vision for a region that is free and open for generations to come and a commitment to working together to get there. https://t.co/ApXBXA2Sex https://t.co/wWVezas6yX
Debi Thomas became the first Black American woman to win a medal at the Winter Olympics. She competed in figure skating and won a bronze medal. https://t.co/Zihh3cUxR8

Vonetta Flowers slid into history by winning the gold medal at the inaugural Women's Olympic bobsled event. Vonetta became the first Black American woman to win a gold medal in the Winter Olympics. https://t.co/Fu4Dc58jHm

Shani Davis became the first Black American athlete to win a gold medal in an individual event at the Winter Games, winning the speedskating 1000-meter event at the 2006 Winter Olympics in Turin. https://t.co/xa8YV1kICu
The #WinterOlympics are underway. Today, we spotlight on a few Black American athletes who have made a mark at past Winter Olympics! #BlackHistoryMonth

urls.title: The U.S. Center
urls.description: The U.S. Department of State organizes and hosts a U.S. Center at the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) Conference of the Parties. This public diplomacy initiative, made possible by input and support from multiple U.S. government agencies, academic institutions, non-governmental organizations, private sector entities, and other stakeholders, highlights key climate programs and scientific research, underscoring the strong actions the United States is taking at home and abroad to combat this global challenge. All U.S. Center events from the full two-week program are streamed live. Live events will start up again on November 1, 2021, during the next UNFCCC Conference of Parties (COP26) in Glasgow, United Kingdom.

urls.description: HDFC Bank, Mastercard, U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC), and U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) today launched a $100 million credit facility to promote and

tweets.text: Just announced: @USAID, @DFCgov, @mastercardindia, @HDFC_Bank launched a $100 million credit guarantee to support small businesses in India to digitize & recover from the economic impacts of #COVID19, with a focus on women-owned businesses. Read more here: https://t.co/tt8pS7xFEo

We congratulate India for the extraordinary accomplishment of administering one billion doses of the COVID-19 vaccine. I applaud India's successes in fighting COVID-19 at home and for its efforts to help end the pandemic in the Indo-Pacific region and well beyond. https://t.co/SJZKVlhCjU

Congratulations to India on administering their 1 billionth dose of COVID-19 vaccine! We applaud India’s commitment to ramp up vaccine production for export and use worldwide. With the #Quad, the U.S. and India are working together to vaccinate the world and end the pandemic.
